result.execSummary:
The defendant Anastassia L Lach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Initial Confinement on Waukesha Co Case 13CF1284, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2, BUT Consecutive to Waukesha Co Case 13CF1284.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid to the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint, except with her permission and under her circumstances.
Defendant to write a letter of apology to the victim.
Case 15CM1484 is dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Initial Confinement on Waukesha Co Case 13CF1284, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 1, BUT Consecutive to Waukesha Co Case 13CF1284.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anastassia L Lach

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.
Character Letter received and filed in court.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Anastassia L Lach in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   

State moves to amend the Felony to (2) counts of misdemeanor theft.
Amended Information filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both amended charges.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both amended charges.

Defense stipulated to the restitution amount of $6,830.00.
Defendant's Aunt presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
Count 1:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to Initial Confinement on Waukesha County case 13CF1284
STAYED

Term of Probation: 18 Months.
Concurrent to:  Count 2
Consecutive to:  Waukesha County case 13CF1284.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint, accept with her permission and under her circumstances.
Letter of apology to the victim.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $6,830 (to be paid to the victim listed in the criminal complaint - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  
 




Count 2:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to the Initial Confinement on Waukesha County case 13CF1284 and Count 1.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 18 Months.
Concurrent to:  Count 1
Consecutive to:   Waukesha County case 13CF1284.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Kelsey Morin in court, defendant Anastassia L Lach not in court, in custody.   
Atty. Morin Waived her clients appearance.
Matter needs to be put over to accomodate victim notification.
Court orders the defendant to remain here pending the next court date.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Anastassia L Lach in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Anastassia L Lach in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
